intro: Vilfa ramulosa, commonly known as the hairy willow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Salicaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the branches. The plant produces catkins, which are its primary floral structures, and it is often found in moist, temperate regions. Vilfa ramulosa is a deciduous shrub that can grow up to several meters in height, and it plays a role in supporting local wildlife. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal practices.
